answers.answer: This has nothing to do with masturbation.You should see a doctor and get tested for thyroid problems, diabetes, Guillain-Barré syndrome, adrenal issues, things like that.Masturbation is harmless and normal in moderation.  Most people do it.  Try to avoid looking at hard porn as it will dull your brain to normal sex.  But this has nothing to do with that.

question: Hi,I've masturbated for about 5-7 years. In that time the longest break I've had was 2 weeks. These days I am fatigued and mentally tired. Also over a month or so I suddenly gained like 20 lbs (153 ----> 173), I'm 5'7". The weight is even harder to shake off; whatever I eat almost feels sensitive to my weight. I feel like I am losing my youngness (I know its not a word). When I exercise it also doesn't feel the same. I can't do things as good as I used to n need to push myself harder. After I workout I usually take like a day to feel somewhat rejuvenated. The supplements I take is Super B-Complex, D3 1000, and Zyrtec for allergies. Now I have taken precautions in not masturbating n I have been 2 days clean.What can I do to reverse these effects and enjoy the rest of my teen years while I still have them?
title: 16 year old: Masturbation and Fatigue
